Name: Pattern Recognition - PE
Text: Alright, so I'm trying to figure out how to label these events based on the machine operations. Let me start by looking at the data provided. Each event has a timestamp, machine ID, and several sensor readings. My goal is to group these events into meaningful activities like cutting, assembling, welding, etc.

Name: Heuristic Reasoning - PE
Text: First, I'll go through each event and note the sensor values. The sensors include temperature, pressure, vibration, material flow, tool position, and energy consumption. These values change over time, so I need to see when they indicate a transition between different activities.

Name: Pattern Recognition - PE
Text: Looking at event 1 to 3, the temperature, pressure, and vibration are low. Material flow is zero, tool position is zero, and energy usage is very low.

Name: Hypothesis Generation - PE
Text: That seems like the start of an operation where nothing is happening, maybe a warm-up phase or just preparation.

Name: Pattern Recognition - PE
Text: Then, from event 4 to 7, there's a significant increase in temperature, especially around 50C and above. Material flow jumps to 5 units/s, and tool position increases to 5mm. Energy consumption also goes up to 2.00 kWh.

Name: Hypothesis Generation - PE
Text: This looks like an active operation, perhaps a cutting phase where tools are active and material is being processed.

Name: Pattern Recognition - PE
Text: At event 8, the material flow drops back to 2 units/s, and tool position is at 15mm. Temperature and pressure are back to normal. Energy usage decreases slightly.

Name: Hypothesis Generation - PE
Text: Maybe this is the end of the cutting phase, transitioning to another activity like a break or cooldown.

Name: Pattern Recognition - PE
Text: Event 9 shows a massive spike in vibration to 50Hz and material flow goes to zero. Tool position jumps to 15mm. Energy usage jumps to 5.00 kWh.

Name: Hypothesis Generation - PE
Text: This looks like a significant change. High vibration and increased energy could indicate a transition to a different activity, maybe moving to the next phase of processing.

Name: Pattern Recognition - IND
Text: In events 10 to 12, the temperature, pressure, and vibration are low again. Material flow is zero, tool position is around 15mm, and energy usage is low.

Name: Hypothesis Generation - IND
Text: This seems like the beginning of a new operation. Maybe a transition to packaging or another assembly phase.

Name: Pattern Recognition - PE
Text: Events 13 to 15 are similar to the initial events 1-3. Low temperature, pressure, and vibration. Material flow is zero, tool position is zero, and energy is low.

Name: Hypothesis Generation - PE
Text: This could be the start of a new cycle, possibly starting the process again.

Name: Deductive Reasoning - PE
Text: So, based on these changes, I think the activities can be labeled as: 1. Preparation (events 1-3) 2. Cutting (events 4-7) 3. Break/Cooldown (events 8) 4. Transition (event 9) 5. New Cycle Start (events 10-12) 6. Preparation (events 13-15)

Name: Validation - PE
Text: Each of these activities is characterized by distinct sensor patterns. Preparation has low activity, while cutting is marked by high material flow and temperature. The break shows a drop in activity, transition shows a spike, and new cycle starts again with low readings.
